timeline.summary: Michael Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP communicated with the U.S. Attorney’s Office regarding the U.S. v. Epstein case (19 Cr. 490). The communication outlined plans to respond to court questions without introducing new facts and to attempt to obtain and review the defendant’s passport and physical evidence. Photographs were attached, noting that pages 6 and 7 of a document were blank and not photographed.

A protective order, drafted by an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, is being sent to Martin G. Weinberg regarding the case EFTA00021650. The order was discussed with Michael Miller, Reid Marty, and others, and the sender requests feedback or a call to discuss it.

On July 25, 2019, individuals within the Epstein defense team (Martin G. Weinberg, Reid Weingarten, Michael Miller) were coordinating efforts to produce materials related to the US v. Epstein case. Andy was involved in the goal of producing the materials before a conference. Martin Weinberg intended to sign a Protective Order and requested information regarding the discovery's format and expected delivery.

Martin G. Weinberg sent an email to Michael Miller regarding a formal preservation/production request for materials related to the “US v Epstein” case. The email included a follow-up request for questions and identified the document as EFTA00014535.

The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York is requesting drives from recipients (including Michael Miller, Martin Weinberg, Reid, and Marc Fernich) to load approximately 12 GB of discovery data. Drives should be delivered to the office address or brought to a conference. A separate hard drive is requested for Mr. Epstein to review the discovery at the MCC.

Martin Weinberg, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent an email to counsel regarding the production of discovery in the case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB). The discovery, including a letter from Michael Miller, was loaded onto a drive and available for pickup at the U.S. Attorney's office. Weinberg offered assistance if there were any difficulties accessing the discovery.

The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent an email to Marc Femich, Martin Weinberg, Reid, and Michael Miller, providing access to the Government’s first discovery production related to 19 Cr. 490 (RMB). The production, consisting of materials linked to Michael Miller, was loaded onto a drive and ready for pickup at the U.S. Attorney’s office. An accompanying discovery and disclosure letter was also attached.

On August 1, 2019, Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP contacted [REDACTED] to inquire about the return of property, specifically a ring, diamonds, and funds. He requested a time to send someone to retrieve them and was coordinating with the FBI and another individual regarding a conference call. The email chain demonstrates attempts to arrange a meeting and follow up on communication regarding the property return.

Michael Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP contacted [REDACTED] regarding an unspecified “Epstein” matter. He requested a pickup for “the ring, diamonds, and funds.” [REDACTED] responded, confirming they had contacted Miller and would attempt to arrange a connection. [REDACTED] also offered to schedule a specific time if initial attempts failed. The email exchange included contact information for Michael Miller and Steptoe & Johnson LLP.

An email chain concerning the case “U.S. v. Epstein” is being distributed between Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP and various recipients, including Reid Weingarten, Martin G. Weinberg, Michael Scavelli, Morgan Lucas, Jim Brochin, and Jason Meade. The email contains an attached letter and includes standard legal disclaimers regarding confidential and privileged information.

On August 2, 2019, Martin G. Weinberg, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent an email regarding the case *US v Epstein*. The email was sent to Michael Miller, Reid Weingarten, and Martin G. Weinberg, requesting that all future communications about the case include all four individuals. The email also included a standard disclaimer regarding the transmission of privileged legal information.

Michael C. Miller, a partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP, sent a letter regarding the case “U.S. v. Epstein” to Michael Scavelli, Jim Brochin, Martin G. Weinberg, Morgan Lucas, Jason Meade, and others. The letter is attached as a PDF named “Discovety_Letter_Aug_1,_2019_-c2.pdf”. The email contains a standard confidentiality notice from Steptoe & Johnson LLP.

On August 7, 2019, Martin G. Weinberg contacted Michael Miller regarding a response to letters sent on July 26 and August 1 seeking preservation of records related to the US v. Epstein case. Weinberg requested Miller advise relevant parties, including US Attorneys in Georgia and CEOS, of the preservation request due on September 13. The expected response timeline was extended slightly due to a follow-up letter received on August 1, with an initial goal of a response by tomorrow (August 9th) or no later than Monday.

*   **Request:** They are formally requesting documents and records from the U.S. Department of Justice related to Jeffrey Epstein’s death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. *   **Specific Requests:** The request includes protocols for inmate deaths, video recordings of entrances/exits and hallways, entry/exit logs, and logs of guards on duty, covering the period from August 9, 2019, to August 10, 2019. *   **Context of Death:** Epstein died in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019, initially appearing as a suicide, prompting an FBI investigation and concern from Attorney General William P. Barr regarding irregularities. *   **Investigation:** The legal team intends to conduct their own investigation into the circumstances surrounding his death.

On August 9, 2019, the Supervisory Staff Attorney discussed Mr. Epstein’s requests with his attorneys, Mariel Colon and Michael Miller. Colon inquired about housing him in the Cadre, which was declined due to his pretrial status. Miller requested housing him alone in SHU, citing a prior suicide attempt/gesture, which was also denied. Neither attorney discussed a suicide watch or psychological observation.

On August 9, 2019, a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center discussed inmate Jeffrey Epstein’s requests with his attorneys, Mariel Colon and Michael Miller. Colon inquired about housing Epstein in the Cadre due to his pretrial status, and Miller requested solitary confinement in SHU due to Epstein’s prior suicide attempt. The attorney stated neither attorney discussed suicide watch or psychological observation during the conversations.

An email chain discusses ongoing investigations related to the case of *US v. Epstein*. A press release from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) was sent to Michael Miller, Marty, and Reid Weingarten, indicating investigations initiated by the Attorney General, including a potential FBI investigation into the cause of death. Further information regarding the apparent cause of death and Mr. Epstein’s observation status is pending.

Michael Miller inquired about confirmation of Jeffrey Epstein’s death via email to Martin G. Weinberg and Reid Weingarten on August 10, 2019. Weinberg responded on July 26, 2019, acknowledging receipt and sending a formal preservation/production request for materials related to the US v. Epstein case.

On August 10, 2019, Michael Miller inquired about arranging a pathologist for Jeffrey Epstein’s autopsy, specifically requesting a delay due to Epstein’s legal counsel’s demand.  Martin Weinberg responded, acknowledging the request and noting a potential autopsy for the following morning.  A third party sent a brief update confirming no further updates were expected that day and expressing hope for thorough investigations. The email chain pertains to the investigation into Epstein’s death.

On August 10, 2019, an individual (identified as "[REDACTED]") communicated with Michael Miller regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s death. The individual confirmed a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) official contacted Epstein’s brother to discuss arrangements for the transport and logistics of Epstein’s body upon readiness. The individual advised Miller to contact BOP directly if needed and directed inquiries to the FBI tip line (1-800-CALL-FBI) while noting ongoing investigations. A press release regarding the situation was attached.  A follow-up email from the same sender confirmed an FBI investigation into Epstein’s death was underway and ongoing efforts to obtain additional information would be communicated.

An email chain discusses Jeffrey Epstein’s autopsy. Michael Miller requested a pathologist be present for the autopsy, aiming for it to be delayed until Tuesday to allow for arrangements. Marty Weinberg forwarded a message from Miller requesting an investigation into Epstein’s death and inquiring about delaying the autopsy. IM sent a brief note stating they wouldn’t have further updates that day and anticipated continued contact regarding the investigation.

An email was sent from EFTA00019950 to Michael Miller, Marty, Reid, and Weingarten, M.M., regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s death. The email included a press release summarizing information received from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP). It confirmed an FBI investigation into the death is underway and expected to be rigorous.

Martin Weinberg sent emails to Mike, Marty, and Reid regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s death.  A letter from the Warden was sent to Mike, detailing ongoing investigations initiated by the Attorney General.  Additional information regarding the cause of death and observation status was lacking but would be provided if obtained.  A press release from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) was attached, confirming an FBI investigation into the death was underway and expected to be rigorous.

Michael Miller forwarded a press release regarding the US v. Epstein case, sourced from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP). The press release contains all available information from BOP. He confirms an FBI investigation into the death has been initiated and anticipates it will be rigorous.

On August 10, 2019, Michael Miller requested an expedited autopsy for Jeffrey Epstein, aiming to complete it by Tuesday to allow for a pathologist’s presence. [REDACTED] informed Miller that no further updates were expected that day but assured continued communication. [REDACTED] sent a letter detailing ongoing investigations initiated by the Attorney General, including a potential FBI investigation, and stated that updates would be provided immediately if received. [REDACTED] distributed a press release from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) summarizing available information, confirming an FBI investigation, and offered ongoing support.

Michael Miller received an email from [REDACTED] regarding the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s death, initiated by the Attorney General and including an FBI investigation. The email included a press release from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) summarizing available information, noting ongoing investigations and a lack of updates regarding the cause of death and Mr. Epstein’s observations. Reid Weingarten and Martin G. Weinberg were also copied on the communications.

An email was sent forwarding correspondence regarding the US v. Epstein case. The email directs Michael Miller to copy Martin Weinberg and Reid Weingarten as legal counsel for notifications, providing their email addresses.

Michael Miller is coordinating an investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein. Initially, an autopsy was planned for the following morning with Michael Baden as the pathologist. However, Dr. Jason Graham, the Chief Medical Examiner, advised delaying the autopsy to potentially two days to allow for securing a pathologist.  Additional emails detail updates regarding investigations initiated by the Attorney General and the FBI, including a press release from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) outlining available information. There's a request to push the autopsy to Tuesday to secure a pathologist.

Martin G. Weinberg contacted [REDACTED] regarding the US v. Epstein case, specifically concerning emails related to Mr. Epstein’s death and preservation/production requests from his family. Weinberg requested DNA collection from evidence at Mr. Epstein’s cell and a taint review of any email or residence seizure reviews. He inquired about the government’s intention to dismiss the indictment and requested the name of the assigned taint attorney.

On August 14, 2019, Michael Miller (Steptoe & Johnson LLP) contacted Martin G. Weinberg and Michael C. Miller regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein’s death (“US v Epstein”). Miller provided contact information for Assistant U.S. Attorneys assigned to the case.  Miller proposed a dial-in time of 9:30 AM the following day and Weinberg and Miller agreed. Weinberg and Miller were authorized to discuss potential civil forfeiture issues.

Martin G. Weinberg emailed Marty, Michael Miller, Reid Weingarten, and Alex regarding a potential civil forfeiture discussion related to the US v. Epstein case. He offered availability at 9:30 AM the following morning and requested a dial-in be circulated.

Michael Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP offered a dial-in number (80943#) for a discussion scheduled for 9:30 AM on August 15, 2019, regarding “US v Epstein.” Martin G. Weinberg and Alex (name redacted) were authorized to continue the discussion concerning potential civil forfeiture issues. Martin G. Weinberg confirmed the 9:30 AM time and requested a dial-in be circulated.

Martin G. Weinberg, Esq., and Michael Reid Weingarten are authorized to discuss potential civil forfeiture issues related to the US v. Epstein case. Weinberg is offering to speak with the recipient at 9:30 AM the following day, August 15, 2019, to hear their perspective.

Martin G. Weinberg contacted Marty [REDACTED] regarding a Petition to Probate the Jeffrey Epstein Estate and Will, which was filed in the Virgin Islands on August 16, 2019. Weinberg requested a copy of the petition from [REDACTED] or someone who could provide it.

Michael Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP sent an email to Judge Berman’s chambers regarding a Government motion for an order of nolle prosequi in the case *U.S. v. Epstein* (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The email included a courtesy copy of the Government’s motion and was copied to defense counsel. An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent the initial email.

A letter motion for an order of nolle prosequi was sent by the Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Judge Berman’s chambers in the case of *U.S. v. Epstein* (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The letter, attached with a proposed order, was submitted following a previous discussion and was copied to defense counsel, Martin Weinberg and Michael Miller.

Michael C. Miller, a partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP, received and signed a stipulation to withdraw the appeal in the case of United States of America v. Epstein (2nd Circuit Docket No. 19-2221). He forwarded the signed stipulation to the sender for filing. The email chain involves communication between Miller and Reid Weingarten, Morgan Lucas, and redacted recipients.

On August 20, 2019, Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP contacted Michael Miller regarding requests for disclosure related to the United States v. Jeffrey Epstein case (19-CRIM-00490, S.D.N.Y.).  AUSA from the Southern District of New York would handle Touhy requests. Due to the defendant’s death and an anticipated nolle prosequi order, no further productions were planned. Service of materials would be provided to Miller but not to other entities, including the MCC and FBI. Correspondence was attached for reference.

On August 20, 2019, Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP sent an email to an individual, attaching a stipulation to withdraw an appeal regarding “Epstein.” The email contained standard contact information for Steptoe & Johnson LLP and a confidentiality disclaimer.

On August 20, 2019, Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP sent an attachment to [REDACTED] regarding a filing related to Jeffrey Epstein. The email was received by Reid Weingarten, Morgan Lucas, and Michael Scavelli. The email included a standard confidentiality disclaimer from Steptoe & Johnson LLP.

Michael Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP sent an email to multiple recipients regarding the case United States of America v. Epstein, U.S. - 2nd Circuit Docket No. 19-2221. The email requests the recipients to sign and return a stipulation to withdraw the appeal, which Miller will then file upon receipt. An attachment, “Draft_Stipulation_to_Withdraw_Appeal-c2.DOC,” was included.

An email chain discusses requests for disclosure related to the United States v. Jeffrey Epstein case (19-CRIM-00490). Michael Miller, a partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP, responds to Michael C. Miller’s request for letters sent by Steptoe regarding requests for disclosure, noting that due to Epstein’s death and a proposed nolle prosequi, no further productions will occur.  The correspondence indicates the DOJ’s Touhy regulations are being followed and that the office will not accept service for separate entities. Copies of the letters are provided as a courtesy for service to the MCC and FBI.

Attorney Marty Weinberg and Michael Miller (of Steptoe & Johnson LLP). *   Weinberg requested a call to ensure alignment on concerns regarding MCC conditions and the client’s death. *   Miller proposed delivering a drive containing materials to the courtroom for production, suggesting an envelope drop-off as an alternative if a meeting outside the courthouse couldn’t be arranged. *   Miller expressed confidence in the Epstein defense team adhering to the protective order and anticipated minimal issues during the court proceedings. *   The communication involved scheduling and logistics related to the presentation of evidence.
